content: This article **relies largely or entirely on a single source**. Relevant discussion may be found on the talk page. Please help improve this article by introducing citations to additional sources. *Find sources:* "Singapore at the 2009 SEA Games" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2021)*Sporting event delegation **[Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)** participated in the **[2009 Southeast Asian Games](/wiki/2009_Southeast_Asian_Games)** which held in the city of [Vientiane](/wiki/Vientiane), [Laos](/wiki/Laos) from 9 December 2009 to 18 December 2009. The games' first gold medal was also won by the **[Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)** water polo team. ## Expectations Singapore entered the games with no official medal targets, but local media the [Straits Times](/wiki/Straits_Times) predicted 30 gold medals. The target is set lower than that for the previous games, as sports where Singapore traditionally does well, such as sailing, gymnastics and bowling were not featured in the games. More specific targets were set by some sports, including swimming (11 golds), shooting (4 golds), football (1 gold), table tennis (7 golds) and water polo (1 gold). While no medals are expected, boxing, a sport Singapore is deputing in, aims to reach the semi-finals. ## Medals **This section is empty.** You can help by adding to it. *(July 2010)* This [Asian Games](/wiki/Asian_Games) article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. This article about sports in Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Singapore at the 2009 SEA Games
